actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:30 p.m. on May 10, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Ms. Tlaib moved that the House do now adjourn.

actions-list.header: SPECIAL ORDER SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

actions-list.header: ONE MINUTE SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Kelly (MS) asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, May 10, 2024, it adourn to meet at noon on Tuesday, May 14, 2024, for morning-hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Kelly (MS) asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Wednesday, May 8, 2024, it adjourn to meet at 12:30 p.m. on Friday, May 10, 2024. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed without objection.

Considered by unanimous consent. H.R. 8063 — "To authorize the Secretary of the Army to posthumously award the Distinguished Service Cross to William D. Owens for his valorous actions from June 6, 1944, to June 8, 1944, during World War II at La Fiere Bridge in Normandy, France, while serving with the 505th Parachute Infantry."
Mr. Kelly (MS) asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 358
actions-list.actionItem: 41 (Roll no. 195).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4143 — "To amend the National Construction Safety Team Act to enable the National Institute of Standards and Technology to investigate structures other than buildings to inform the development of engineering standards, best practices, and building codes related to such structures, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 393
actions-list.actionItem: 13, 1 Present (Roll no. 194).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 870 — "To amend the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 to authorize appropriations for the United States Fire Administration and firefighter assistance grant programs."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 206
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 203

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Manning moved to recommit to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7109 — "To require a citizenship question on the decennial census, to require reporting on certain census statistics, and to modify apportionment of Representatives to be based on United States citizens instead of all persons."
Pursuant to clause 1(c) of rule XIX, the House proceeded with further consideration of H.R. 7109.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 216
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 203

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2925 — "To amend the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 to provide for security of tenure for use of mining claims for ancillary activities, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 228

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.J. Res. 109 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to "Staff Accounting Bulletin No. 121"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to table the measure Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 359
actions-list.actionItem: 43, 7 Present (Roll no. 188).
Mr. Scalise moved to table the measure.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1209 — "Declaring the office of Speaker of the House of Representatives to be vacant."

actions-list.header: QUESTION OF THE PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Greene (GA) rose to a question of the privileges of the House and offered the resolution. The Chair directed the Clerk to report the resolution. Upon examination of the resolution, the Chair determined that the resolution did constitute a question of the privileges of the House.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Greene (GA) notified the House of her intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 385
actions-list.actionItem: 24, 1 Present (Roll no. 187).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8289 — "To extend authorizations for the airport improvement program, to extend the funding and expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to clause 1(c) of Rule XIX, further consideration of H.R. 7109 is postponed.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 7109.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 6192, H.R. 7109, H.J. Res. 109 and H.R. 2925. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 6192 under a structured rule and H.R. 7109, H.J. Res. 109, and H.R. 2925 under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate on H.R. 6192, H.R. 7109, and H.J. Res. 109, and thirty minutes of general debate on H.R. 2925. One motion to recommit allowed on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1194. H.R. 7109 — "To require a citizenship question on the decennial census, to require reporting on certain census statistics, and to modify apportionment of Representatives to be based on United States citizens instead of all persons."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8289.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8289 — "To extend authorizations for the airport improvement program, to extend the funding and expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating the continuation of the national emergency with respect to the Central African Republic declared in Executive Order 13667 of May 12, 2014, is to continue in effect beyond May 12, 2024.
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-140).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency declared in Executive Order 13873 of May 15, 2019, with respect to securing the information and communications technology and services supply chain, is to continue in effect beyond May 15, 2024.
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-139).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the National Emergency with respect to the actions of the Government of Syria declared in Executive Order 13338 of May 11, 2004 is to continue in effect beyond May 11, 2024.
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-138).

actions-list.header: POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS
actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 2925, the Chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Leger Fernandez demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Leger Fernandez moved to recommit to the Committee on Natural Resources.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on H.R. 2925.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 6192, H.R. 7109, H.J. Res. 109 and H.R. 2925. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 6192 under a structured rule and H.R. 7109, H.J. Res. 109, and H.R. 2925 under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate on H.R. 6192, H.R. 7109, and H.J. Res. 109, and thirty minutes of general debate on H.R. 2925. One motion to recommit allowed on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1194. H.R. 2925 — "To amend the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 to provide for security of tenure for use of mining claims for ancillary activities, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS
actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 109, the Chair put the question on passage of the joint resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McHenry demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 109.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 6192, H.R. 7109, H.J. Res. 109 and H.R. 2925. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 6192 under a structured rule and H.R. 7109, H.J. Res. 109, and H.R. 2925 under a closed rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate on H.R. 6192, H.R. 7109, and H.J. Res. 109, and thirty minutes of general debate on H.R. 2925. One motion to recommit allowed on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1194. H.J. Res. 109 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to "Staff Accounting Bulletin No. 121"."

actions-list.header: ONE MINUTE SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.

actions-list.header: PLEDGE OF ALLEGIANCE
actions-list.actionItem: The Chair designated Mr. Carl to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.

actions-list.header: MORNING-HOUR DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Michael Cloud to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
